text.div:
Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition ext-R5-Permission

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Extension 0..*Extension(4.0.1)Access Rules
Slices for extension 2..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:url
extension:status 1..1Extensionactive | entered-in-error | draft | rejected
url 1..1uri"status"
value[x] 1..1codeactive | entered-in-error | draft | rejected
extension:asserter 0..1ExtensionThe person or entity that asserts the permission
url 1..1uri"asserter"
value[x] 0..1Reference(Cross-version Profile for R5.Practitioner for use in FHIR R4(0.0.1-snapshot-3) | Practitioner | Cross-version Profile for R5.PractitionerRole for use in FHIR R4(0.0.1-snapshot-3) | PractitionerRole | Cross-version Profile for R5.Organization for use in FHIR R4(0.0.1-snapshot-3) | Organization | Cross-version Profile for R5.CareTeam for use in FHIR R4(0.0.1-snapshot-3) | CareTeam | Cross-version Profile for R5.Patient for use in FHIR R4(0.0.1-snapshot-3) | Patient | Cross-version Profile for R5.RelatedPerson for use in FHIR R4(0.0.1-snapshot-3) | RelatedPerson | Cross-version Profile for R5.HealthcareService for use in FHIR R4(0.0.1-snapshot-3) | HealthcareService)The person or entity that asserts the permission
extension:date 0..*ExtensionThe date that permission was asserted
url 1..1uri"date"
value[x] 0..1dateTimeThe date that permission was asserted
extension:validity 0..1ExtensionThe period in which the permission is active
url 1..1uri"validity"
value[x] 0..1PeriodThe period in which the permission is active
extension:justification 0..1ExtensionThe asserted justification for using the data
Slices for extension 0..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:url
extension:basis 0..*ExtensionThe regulatory grounds upon which this Permission builds
url 1..1uri"basis"
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptThe regulatory grounds upon which this Permission builds
Binding: http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/ValueSet/ValueSet-R5-consent-policy-for-R4 (example): Regulatory policy examples
extension:evidence 0..*ExtensionJustifing rational
url 1..1uri"evidence"
value[x] 0..1Reference(Cross-version Profile for R5.Resource for use in FHIR R4(0.0.1-snapshot-3) | Resource)Justifing rational
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Permission.justification"
value[x] 0..0Value of extension
extension:combining 1..1Extensiondeny-overrides | permit-overrides | ordered-deny-overrides | ordered-permit-overrides | deny-unless-permit | permit-unless-deny
url 1..1uri"combining"
value[x] 1..1codedeny-overrides | permit-overrides | ordered-deny-overrides | ordered-permit-overrides | deny-unless-permit | permit-unless-deny
extension:rule 0..*ExtensionConstraints to the Permission
Slices for extension 0..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:url
extension:type 0..1Extensiondeny | permit
url 1..1uri"type"
value[x] 0..1codedeny | permit
Binding: http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/ValueSet/ValueSet-R5-consent-provision-type-for-R4 (required): How a rule statement is applied.
extension:data 0..*ExtensionThe selection criteria to identify data that is within scope of this provision
Slices for extension 0..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:url
extension:resource 0..*ExtensionExplicit FHIR Resource references
Slices for extension 2..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:url
extension:meaning 1..1Extensioninstance | related | dependents | authoredby
url 1..1uri"meaning"
value[x] 1..1codeinstance | related | dependents | authoredby
Binding: http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/ValueSet/ValueSet-R5-consent-data-meaning-for-R4 (required): How a resource reference is interpreted when testing consent restrictions.
extension:reference 1..1ExtensionThe actual data reference
url 1..1uri"reference"
value[x] 1..1Reference(Cross-version Profile for R5.Resource for use in FHIR R4(0.0.1-snapshot-3) | Resource)The actual data reference
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Permission.rule.data.resource"
value[x] 0..0Value of extension
extension:security 0..*ExtensionSecurity tag code on .meta.security
url 1..1uri"security"
value[x] 0..1CodingSecurity tag code on .meta.security
extension:period 0..*ExtensionTimeframe encompasing data create/update
url 1..1uri"period"
value[x] 0..1PeriodTimeframe encompasing data create/update
extension:expression 0..1ExtensionExpression identifying the data
url 1..1uri"expression"
value[x] 0..1ExpressionExpression identifying the data
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Permission.rule.data"
value[x] 0..0Value of extension
extension:activity 0..*ExtensionA description or definition of which activities are allowed to be done on the data
Slices for extension 0..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:url
extension:actor 0..*ExtensionAuthorized actor(s)
url 1..1uri"actor"
value[x] 0..1Reference(Cross-version Profile for R5.Device for use in FHIR R4(0.0.1-snapshot-3) | Device | Cross-version Profile for R5.Group for use in FHIR R4(0.0.1-snapshot-3) | Group | Cross-version Profile for R5.CareTeam for use in FHIR R4(0.0.1-snapshot-3) | CareTeam | Cross-version Profile for R5.Organization for use in FHIR R4(0.0.1-snapshot-3) | Organization | Cross-version Profile for R5.Patient for use in FHIR R4(0.0.1-snapshot-3) | Patient | Cross-version Profile for R5.Practitioner for use in FHIR R4(0.0.1-snapshot-3) | Practitioner | Cross-version Profile for R5.RelatedPerson for use in FHIR R4(0.0.1-snapshot-3) | RelatedPerson | Cross-version Profile for R5.PractitionerRole for use in FHIR R4(0.0.1-snapshot-3) | PractitionerRole)Authorized actor(s)
extension:action 0..*ExtensionActions controlled by this rule
url 1..1uri"action"
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptActions controlled by this rule
Binding: http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/ValueSet/ValueSet-R5-consent-action-for-R4 (example): Detailed codes for the action.
extension:purpose 0..*ExtensionThe purpose for which the permission is given
url 1..1uri"purpose"
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptThe purpose for which the permission is given
Binding: http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/ValueSet/ValueSet-R5-v3-PurposeOfUse-for-R4 (preferred): What purposes of use are controlled by this exception. If more than one label is specified, operations must have all the specified labels.
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Permission.rule.activity"
value[x] 0..0Value of extension
extension:limit 0..*ExtensionWhat limits apply to the use of the data
url 1..1uri"limit"
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptWhat limits apply to the use of the data
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Permission.rule"
value[x] 0..0Value of extension
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Permission"
value[x] 0..0Value of extension

Documentation for this format

name: ExtensionPermission
title: Cross-version Extension `R5.Permission` for use in FHIR R4
description: This cross-version extension represents the FHIR R5 element `Permission` for use in FHIR R4.
purpose:
This extension is part of the cross-version definitions generated to enable use of the
element `Permission` as defined in FHIR R5
in FHIR R4.

The source element is defined as:
`Permission` 0..* `Permission`

Across FHIR versions, the element set has been mapped as:
* R5 `Permission` 0..* `Permission`

Following are the generation technical comments:
Element `Permission` is not mapped to FHIR R4, since FHIR R5 `Permission` is not mapped.

element.definition: Permission resource holds access rules for a given data and context.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: The data in scope are those with the given codes present in that data .meta.security element.
element.comment: Note the ConfidentialityCode vocabulary indicates the highest value, thus a security label of "R" then it applies to all resources that are labeled "R" or lower. E.g. for Confidentiality, it's a high water mark. For other kinds of security labels, subsumption logic applies. When the purpose of use tag is on the data, access request purpose of use shall not conflict.
element.requirements: Element `Permission.rule.data.security` is not mapped to FHIR R4, since FHIR R5 `Permission` is not mapped.
